page.title: 10SHAKESPEARE PUB
page.content: This pub is on Braunstone Lane, and was built in 1655 as a farm house and it became a public house in 1955. Opening times - 1100 - 1430 and 1800 - 2300 Mild, bitter and lager beers were sold and the pub has got a darts team. 16 people work in the pub but some of these are part-time and work only when the pub is open. The landlord buys the beer from the Everards brewery. Children who spoke to the landlord asked if children were normally allowed in the pub. The answer was no, but there was a games room where children could play and have soft drinks. People can have meals at lunchtimes and the pub can also cater for wedding and other parties. The thatched roof costs Â£30,000 to repair.
